definition: to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity
to invite disaster

sentences.english: This child is always making trouble for his parents.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子老给父母招灾惹祸。

sentences.english: Bring misfortune of recruit son, terrified don't want.
sentences.chinese: 惹祸的招子，怕别想要了。

sentences.english: There once was a lady who was very concerned about heer missing parrot.
sentences.chinese: 曾经有一个女士非常关心她惹祸的鹦鹉。

sentences.english: Sometimes I would tap their hands when they made troubles.
sentences.chinese: 当他们惹祸时，有时候我会轻拍他们的手。

sentences.english: Giving certain gifts could get you in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 送礼不当可能会使你惹祸上身。

sentences.english: If you steal, you'll be in trouble. You'll be arrested.
sentences.chinese: 你偷东西就会惹祸，你会被抓起来。

definition: to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to cause trouble
to stir up trouble
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
to stir up trouble/to get into trouble
to make a mess of sth
confused/mixed up/muddled up/befuddled
to stir up trouble
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
disaster/doom
to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
meddling in other people's business
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity
